Available data

Data released with the package

Example Rcongas fit.

Fitting functions

Functions to cluster the data.

Approximation of the library size prior

Model selection with CONGAS.

List models available in the package.

S3 functions

The rcongas S3 object.

Print for an object of class 'rcongas'.

Summary for an object of class 'rcongas'.

Print for an object of class 'rcongas'.

plot_raw_data()

plot_highlights()

plot_highlights = function(x, alpha = 0.05) # Best model best_model <- Rcongas:::get_best_model(x) res <- data.frame( t(best_model$parameters$cnv_probs), stringsAsFactors = FALSE, check.names = FALSE ) dplyr::mutate(segment_id = rownames(.)) deidify() reshape2::melt( id.vars = c("chr", "from", "to"), variable.name = "cluster", value.name = "CN" ) dplyr::mutate(cluster = as.character(cluster)) str_starts(cluster, pattern = "c|C"), cluster, paste0("c", cluster) )) dplyr::as_tibble() dplyr::mutate(lognorm_CN = CN) res$highlights = create_highlights(res, alpha) # Normalise CNA values for comparisons # means = res # dplyr::group_by(chr, from, to) # dplyr::summarise(segment_mean = mean(CN), .groups = 'keep') # dplyr::ungroup() # # # Bind everything # res = res # dplyr::full_join(means, by = c('chr', 'from', 'to')) # dplyr::mutate(lognorm_CN = CN, # CN = CN - segment_mean) res$highlight = create_highlights(res, alpha) # Clones clones = Rcongas::get_clusters(x)$cluster res_split = res names(res_split) = sapply(res_split, function(x) x$cluster[1]) df_density = NULL for (i in clones) for (j in clones) if (i != j) f = get_density_gamma_highlights(res, i, j) x_ij = x filter(cluster group_by(chr, from, to) summarise(diff_ij = abs(diff(lognorm_CN))) # Fit density function den_ij = data.frame( x = seq(0, max(x_ij$diff_ij) * 1.25, length.out = 30), y = dgamma( seq(0, max(x_ij$diff_ij) * 1.25, length.out = 30), fit_ij$estimate[[1]], fit_ij$estimate[[2]] ), stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) df_density = df_density bind_rows(den_ij ggplot(df_density, aes(x=x,y=y, color=pair))+geom_point()

Getters for clustering results

Functions to extract clustering information from a model.

get_clusters()

Extract cell clustering assignments.

get_clusters_ploidy()

Extract the clusters ploidy profiles.

get_clusters_size()

Extract size of clusters.

get_k()

Extract the number of mixture components.

get_segment_test_counts()

Wilcoxon test for difference in RNA counts among groups.

Getters for input data

Functions to extract information of the data stored in a model.

get_counts()

Title

get_input_segmentation()

Title

get_mapped_genes()

get_input_raw_data()

get_reference_genome()

Reference genome used in a model.

get_gene_annotations()

Genome coordinates available in the package.

get_dataset_stats()

Return dataset statistics

get_segment_ids()

Extract the segment ids (for indexing).

Filter functions

Functions to filter out information from a model.

filter_clusters()

Filter output clusters

Synthetic data generation functions

Functions to sample from the generative model.

generate_random_tree()

Generate a random tree

run_simulation()

Run a complete simulation
